chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Abigail P Sockness was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Uttering a Forgery [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**0 days credit if probation revoked.**

If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Cases 21CF1068, 21CF1385.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $527.08 to include 5% and 10% restitution surcharges.
AODA and follow through with recommendations.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Forfeit all seized money of $400.00 to the WCDTF in 21CF1385 Count 1. 
Testify truthfully in any legal proceeding for which she is subpoenaed.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations.

No contact with J.P., S.K., A.P., J.S., D.Y., C.M., G.D., J.D., any RCU locations. 
No contact with any drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting.

charges.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $500 but does not Exceed $10,000)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Abigail P Sockness

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Ordered in the amount of $527.08
Plus 10% Restitution Surcharge
Same as Complaint just renumbering Counts from Counts 18-21 to Counts 1-4.

(1:59 PM cases 21CF1068, 21CF1385, 22CF93 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Abigail P Sockness appeared by video, in custody in the Chippewa County Jail. Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared by video for Abigail P Sockness.
Victim/Witness statute complied with. Agreement has been reached and is recited by counsel.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in cases 21CF1385, 22CF93 and Court accepts waivers. 
Prior offenses acknowledged for repeater and second and subsequent offenses.
State will file an Information in cases 21CF1385 and 22CF93 which will mirror the complaints.
Defendant pleads Guilty to 21CF1068 Count 1: Delivery of Methamphetamine (<=3g) as Party to a Crime, Repeater and Second and Subsequent Offense, 21CF1385 Count 1: Possession with Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine (>3-10g) as Repeater and Second and Subsequent Offense and to 22CF93 Count 1: Uttering a Forgery as Repeater.
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the defendant's Guilty pleas and finds the defendant Guilty of 21CF1068 Count 1, 21CF1385 Count 1 and 22CF93 Count 1.
Attorney Kelm advises defendant will waive right to any PSI and requests to proceed as the agreement has been laid out to the Court.

Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 4 years with the following conditions on all 3 counts concurrently:
120 days jail with Huber privileges, stayed pending further order of the Court on 21CF1068 Count 1. AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with J.P., S.K., A.P., J.S., D.Y., C.M., G.D., J.D., any RCU locations. No contact with any drug dealers/users, except in a therapeutic setting. Forfeit all seized money of $400.00 to the WCDTF in 21CF1385 Count 1. Testify truthfully in any legal proceeding for which she is subpoenaed. Restitution in the amount of $527.08 plus 5% and 10% surcharges in case 22CF93 Count 1. Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge and pay court costs x3 to include $80.00 in buy funds from 21CF1068 Count 1. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 3 days credit if probation revoked in 21CF1385. 0 days credit if probation revoked in cases 21CF1068 and 22CF93. Any remaining charges including case 21TR10508 are dismissed and read in.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)

(11:01 AM cases 21CF1068, 21CF1385, 22CF93 called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Abigail P Sockness appeared by video, in custody in the Chippewa County Jail. Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared by video for Abigail P Sockness.
State notes the newest case is set for an Initial appearance and notes the case has already had time limits waived and bond set.
Attorney Kelm advises was just recently appointed and would like to discuss a global resolution with the State.
Attorney Kelm requests one more status conference about a month out.
Status Conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 2 pm via Zoom (1/2 hour).
Status conference on March 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions: 
No contact with S.K. (co-defendant), A.P., J.S., or D.Y.
Initial appearance on February 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(Case called at 11:01 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Abigail Sockness appears by video from the Chippewa County Jail. Attorney Karl Schmidt appears by video separately on behalf of Attorney Kerry Kelm. Attorney Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates no one has met with the Defendant regarding the complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Initial Appearance: 02/14/2022 at 11:00 AM.

Conditions: 
No contact with S.K. (co-defendant), A.P., J.S., or D.Y.
